data.title: Why is Atom using bandwidth?
data.body: I'm paying by the GB this week, so I've been monitoring my network activity pretty closely, and I've noticed that Atom is pulling down 74 MB every time it starts up.  That's not huge, but it's a significant chunk of data.  What's going on there?

data.title: Can't open a directory called specs
data.body:
i'm not sure what's going on here. it only happens on this directory, but if i make another directory called specs, atom opens.

i open atom by going to the folder in the terminal and typing `atom` or `atom .`.

![screen shot 2015-01-15 at 11 13 51 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/643505/5764594/2e7d96a6-9ca8-11e4-86db-63b5308f6a83.png)

what else do you guys need?

data.title: Atom stopped working for good in Windows 8.1
data.body:
Atom stopped opening for me after the 0.170.0 to 0.172.0 update. I closed Atom normally and when I went to open it again it no longer did.
There are no errors showing however Atom is definitely running as it has tasks opened when I open the Task Manager.
And the worst part... I already reinstalled it and it still isn't opening.

I can open it with atom --safe however the problem is not solved with this.

data.title: 'Search in Directory' not showing results
data.body:
Sometimes 'Search in Directory' will not show results. It seems to happen mostly in directories with more than a few files, but I cannot pinpoint the volume needed. 

My system is Win7, Atom 0.172.0, but I've seen it happen in previous versions.

Here's a gif it it happening while searching for a word contained in Ionic's scss files.

![search](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4172079/5761361/dfe1d52c-9cd2-11e4-95e9-9e515d0e0a9d.gif)

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'tokenizeLine' of undefined
data.body:
TypeError: Cannot read property 'tokenizeLine' of undefined
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.buildTokenizedTokenizedLineForRow (c:\Users\Sean\s\atom-windows\Atom\resources\app\src\tokenized-buffer.js:428:27)
  at TokenizedBuffer.module.exports.TokenizedBuffer.tokenizeNextChunk (c:\Users\Sean\s\atom-windows\Atom\resources\app\src\tokenized-buffer.js:261:43)
  at c:\Users\Sean\s\atom-windows\Atom\resources\app\src\tokenized-buffer.js:243:26
  at c:\Users\Sean\s\atom-windows\Atom\resources\app\node_modules\roaster\node_modules\underscore\underscore.js:666:47

I think this is error is caused by https://github.com/benjohnson/atom-django-templates/blob/master/grammars/html%20(django).cson

but I think atom error messages should be better at helping me pin down the offending expression

data.title: Remove -webkit prefixes on Flexbox
data.body: Flexbox now works un-prefixed. It's not urgent, but would be nice to remove all the `-webkit` prefixes.

data.title: Master branch compilation error.
data.body:
I usually use master branch because I want receive latest fastest.
But today, It has lots errors. So I rollback it.

Please check and test before commit on master.

Warning and errors.

../node_modules/native-mate/vendor/base-minimal/src/base/bind.h:499:18: warning: typedef ‘p7_is_refcounted_type_and_needs_scoped_refptr’ locally defined but not used [-Wunused-local-typedefs]

Error: 404 status code downloading tarball
gyp ERR! stack     at Request.<anonymous> (/usr/local/src/atom/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/install.js:230:14)

data.title: Move from LESS to Postcss
data.body:
In #5075 I proposed to componentizing CSS, So I also wanna propose to use  [POSTCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) instead of LESS, cause it faster and allow us to use new CSS features, like CSS variables, nested media (by plugins) and desclude features that we really don't need.

Also, we can use autoprefixer to prefixing properties that really need it instead of hard typing prefixes like `display: -webkit-flex` and other.

data.title: Suitify Atom CSS
data.body:
Let's make Atom CSS componentable.For this we can use BEM methodology or more powerful and maintainable [SUIT CSS](https://github.com/suitcss/suit) project by @necolas. It'll allow us to maintain CSS very-very easy.
Also it break compatibility, but You really don't worry about it, do you?

If You like it, please, let me know and I'll start to work on it. Thanks.

data.title: Atom javascript error on windows 8.1
data.body:
HI, I'm trying to run atom 0.172.0 on windows 81.

It installed correctly but it does not launch.

I have atom and apm avaialable in the console (I can run atom -v f.ex.)

If I execute the program directly nothing happens. If I execute atom -s in the console I get the following error:

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4996457/5754316/8c414d70-9c97-11e4-9c62-2f170c6a5ceb.PNG)

I have no packages installed. It's a completelly clean install.

I don't know if there are logs that could help debugging this.

the setup seemed to go well and I've got this in squirrelsetup.log

```
Program: Starting Squirrel Updater: --download https://atom.io/api/updates
Program: Fetching update information, downloading from https://atom.io/api/updates
CheckForUpdateImpl: Downloading RELEASES file from https://atom.io/api/updates
FileDownloader: Downloading url: 
```

data.title: Handle broken locale correctly
data.body:
As figured out in #5024 when locales are not configured correctly (e.g. wrong locales generated) atom shows weird behavior with special characters and syntax highlighting.

Instead a warning message should be displayed, or this should be fixed in another way.

You may refer to [this file](https://cronosx.de/share/download.php?id=8d23cf6c86e834a7aa6eded54c26ce2bb2e74903538c61bdd5d2197997ab2f72) as example which will be rendered like this:

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1491574/5735693/5a6c6a00-9bca-11e4-8986-93572a535dac.png)

data.title: Windows installer shouldn't assume the install location
data.body: While I admire the simplicity of the installer, it also globs it onto the C drive without asking. My C drive is a very small SSD, and while Atom isn't exactly a huge program, I'd prefer to have it on my HDD.

data.title: Failed to load keymap.cson
data.body:
**Error Message:**
While attempting to open a whole folder content in atom, it shows an error message:
"Failed to load keymap.cson"

**How to reproduce:**
Just try to open atom (with or without a folder as argument), like:
`$ atom linux-3.18.2`  or `$ atom`

Then the (ugly) message below will be shown:
![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4237343/5753493/9675c594-9c71-11e4-862d-951620826e1e.png)

**Details:**
- Atom 0.172.0 , who is supposed to [fix an issue  with `.cson` files](https://atom.io/releases);
- Fedora Linux 20 (64bit);
- It should be related to [this](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5037#issuecomment-69951466).

data.title: Fix deprecations in packages with 'gutter' decorations
data.body:
Once https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5068 is released, we need to fix deprecations in the following packages:
- [x] bookmarks
- [x] git-diff

data.title: Rename 'gutter' decorations to 'line-number'
data.body: We're talking about adding APIs for multiple gutters, so the name 'gutter' for these decorations doesn't really make sense. What we're actually decorating is the _line numbers_, which will be just one of the potential gutters on an atom editor.

data.title: Don't call deprecated method in infinite loop
data.body:
See also alexcorre/git-blame#56

Note: I didn't check for other instances of this refactoring error

data.title: Fix getOriginUrl calling itself
data.body: I see this error when using `git-blame` package which is using the deprecated method `getOriginUrl`. Since it's the method is referring to itself, it's causing `Maximum call stack size` (https://github.com/alexcorre/git-blame/issues/56).

data.title: Indentation guides cause cursor to drift
data.body:
Every time I indent a line, the cursor appears to drift 1px to the left due to the newly inserted indentation guide. If I toggle the guides off, the cursor position is corrected:

![screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/8oVNYKe.gif)

I would expect the cursor to be correctly aligned when indentation guides are visible. I'm using Atom 0.172.0 on OS X 10.9.5

data.title: Atom installation/updating garbles %PATH%
data.body:
The character _é_ in my user %PATH% environment variable gets garbled after installing Atom. It seems to happen after an auto-update as well.

Before installation:

```
C:\Users\René\AppData\Roaming\npm
```

After installation (actual):

```
C:\Users\Ren�\AppData\Roaming\npm;c:\Users\René\AppData\Local\atom\bin
```

Expected:

```
C:\Users\René\AppData\Roaming\npm;c:\Users\René\AppData\Local\atom\bin
```

Windows 7 SP1
Atom 0.172.0

data.title: Clicking package title of uninstalled package in Install search list does nothing
data.body:
If you go to preferences, open the Install page, enter something into the search form, then a list of packages will show up. Their titles will be styled as links, but clicking on the titles of uninstalled packages does nothing. (I'd expect it to go to a page about that package, or at least open the package's page on atom.io in a browser window.) Clicking the title of an installed package brings you to an atom page for the package that gives you more info about the package.

Atom 0.170.0 on OS X

data.title: Fix folds with splits
data.body:
The first commit fixes an error that caused #4099; we were accidentally comparing folds from two different `DisplayBuffer`s, on the same `TextBuffer`.

 The second commit is a refactor to make it easier to avoid this kind of error. It makes it so that any time a `DisplayBuffer` is used to find or create markers, they are associated with that `DisplayBuffer`.

data.title: Upgrade to Squirrel for Windows 0.8
data.body:
### Upside
- `--silent` is now supported to `AtomSetup.exe` so https://github.com/atom/chocolatey/pull/35 can be released after this comes out
- `AtomSetup.exe` will now have the Atom icon when downloaded
- [Other bug fixes](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows/releases/tag/0.8.0)

data.title: File location is wrong on title
data.body:
![qq20150115-6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3364271/5744008/1e9efe78-9c58-11e4-92fb-8309de0cff27.png)

![qq20150115-7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3364271/5743951/a89aac22-9c57-11e4-8c58-daaed03efa0d.png)

You can find the correct location on the tree view, but on title the location don't change.

If this location is represent for the current folder on the view, it will confuse the user. It will be a disaster for a user editing 2 files with the same name in different folders.

I think this title is to indicate the current file location, so this must be a bug..

data.title: hard to see cursor
data.body: When I edit my file on Atom, cursor is hard to see on editor. What should I do?

data.title: A mechanism to visit the parent folder in tree view
data.body:
Why not add a mechanism in tree view that can visit it's parent folder?
like add a line .. on the top of tree view

Now I must do "Show in Finder" —> find the file in parent folder -> drag it into Atom ->"Reveal in tree view" to show the parent folder content in the tree view.

By the way, if you really do so, you will find you can not get the tree view of the parent folder. It only highlights the current folder. See more detail in #4524 

Thank you
